summary: This bill, the Local Food Recycling and Regenerative Opportunities Act, amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide tax credits for individuals who divert food waste. It offers a credit for purchasing qualified residential food recycling appliances (up to $300) and for qualified residential organic waste services (up to $120). The bill defines specific criteria for these appliances and services and includes a denial of double benefit clause. The credits are set to expire after December 31, 2031, with the changes effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
